skill.name: clinicaltrials-database
skill.description: Query ClinicalTrials.gov via API v2. Search trials by condition, drug, location, status, or phase. Retrieve trial details by NCT ID, export data, for clinical research and patient matching.
skill.summary: Query ClinicalTrials.gov via API v2. Search trials by condition, drug, location, status, or phase. R...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill consists of documentation and a Python helper script for querying the official ClinicalTrials.gov API. The code makes read-only HTTP GET requests to a US NIH government API endpoint and processes JSON responses. No file access beyond user's local directory, no environment variable reads, no external commands, and no network calls to suspicious endpoints. Minimal risk profile appropriate for clinical research data retrieval.

low_findings.title: File write capability in user examples
low_findings.description: The SKILL.md documentation includes examples showing how to write API responses to local CSV files (lines 314-332). This is standard functionality for data export use cases and aligns with the skill's documented purpose of 'Data export' for clinical research. The script itself does not write files; it returns data that users may optionally save.

content.value_statement: Finding clinical trials for patients, research, or drug development requires navigating a complex registry. This skill provides a Python interface to query the official ClinicalTrials.gov database. Search by condition, drug, location, or sponsor to find recruiting trials, retrieve detailed study information, and export data for analysis.
actual_capabilities: Search clinical trials by condition, disease, or medical diagnosis
Find trials by intervention, drug name, or treatment type
Locate trials in specific geographic locations or cities
Filter by sponsor organization or institution
Retrieve detailed trial information including eligibility criteria
Export results to CSV format for analysis
limitations: Public API with approximately 50 requests per minute rate limit
Cannot access trials that have been removed from the registry
Does not provide real-time enrollment status updates
Limited to data available in the ClinicalTrials.gov database

use_cases.title: Find trials for analysis
use_cases.description: Search for completed trials with results to analyze study designs, outcomes, and findings for meta-analyses or literature reviews.

use_cases.title: Match patients to trials
use_cases.description: Find recruiting trials for patients based on their diagnosis, location, and eligibility criteria for treatment options.

use_cases.title: Track drug development
use_cases.description: Monitor trials for specific drugs or interventions, track sponsor activity, and analyze competitive landscape.

prompt_templates.title: Find recruiting trials
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the clinicaltrials-database skill to find recruiting trials for [condition: breast cancer] in [location: California].

prompt_templates.title: Get trial details
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve full details for trial NCT04852770 including eligibility criteria and contact information.

prompt_templates.title: Export trial data
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for Phase 3 immunotherapy trials for [condition: lung cancer] and export results to CSV format.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-filter search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find trials sponsored by [organization: National Cancer Institute] testing [intervention: pembrolizumab] that are currently recruiting.

output_examples.input: Find recruiting diabetes trials in New York
output: Found 23 recruiting diabetes trials in New York:
â€¢ NCT01234567: A Study of Insulin Glargine in Type 2 Diabetes - Recruiting
â€¢ NCT02345678: Metformin Plus Lifestyle Intervention - Recruiting
â€¢ NCT03456789: Continuous Glucose Monitoring Trial - Recruiting
Each trial includes facility location, eligibility age range, and contact information.

best_practices: Include specific filters like status, phase, and location to narrow results efficiently
Use maximum page size (1000) when retrieving bulk data to minimize API calls
Implement error handling with timeouts and retry logic for production use
anti_patterns: Avoid running bulk queries without rate limit awareness (50 requests per minute)
Do not assume all fields exist in every trial response; use safe navigation with .get()
Avoid hardcoding NCT IDs without verifying the trial still exists

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool can use the provided Python functions to query clinical trial data.

faq.question: How many trials can I search at once?
faq.answer: The API allows up to 1000 results per page. Use pagination tokens to retrieve larger datasets while respecting the rate limit.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my own application?
faq.answer: Yes. The Python script can be imported as a module. Copy the functions to your project and use the requests library to call the API directly.

faq.question: Is patient data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only queries public trial information from ClinicalTrials.gov. No patient data is accessed, stored, or transmitted.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limit errors?
faq.answer: The API allows about 50 requests per minute. Add delays between requests or use smaller result sets. Check for 429 status codes and wait 60 seconds before retrying.

faq.question: How does this compare to ClinicalTrials.gov website?
faq.answer: The API provides structured access to the same database. It enables automated searches, bulk data retrieval, and integration into workflows that the website interface does not support.
